Use ember-qunit. (ref #520)

Import helpers from ember-qunit.

Don't slice if parentBase has just one element.

require('ember-qunit') was failing because we couldn't  find module './isolated-container'.

ember-qunit allow us to do require('ember-qunit') which internally does "import isolatedContainer from './isolated-container"

When requiring, the loader was calling "resolve" with
child="./isolatedContainer" and name = "ember-qunit", resolving to
'./isolated-container' which is wrong, it should have been
'ember-qunit/isolated-container', the reason is that

 "ember-qunit".split('/').slice(0, -1) === []

Is this is a case we didn't handle or are parents names suppose to
have "/"?

Changes live reload port to higher to make potential collisions less likely.

Live reload ports are now 35729 + an offset depending on what port is
chosen for the main server.

Fixes watch port collisions when running multiple instances of EAK

If you have connect-live-reload installed then the custom port number
gets clobbered, resulting in the default watch port always being set.

Merge pull request #501 from MajorBreakfast/master

Dasherize all file names
Dasherize all file names

[Fixes #490, #488] restore run-time cycle support to the loader.

This does so, while continue to support good error handling semantics.
If the module failed to load, previously it would not fail to load the second time, merely become the empty SEEN object. This results in very crappy debugging experiences.

Also, wrapping the experience in a try/catch would cause different but equally as terrible experiences.

So this solution utilizes a try/finally to correctly set and track state of modules.
Please note, that if an error occurs while loading a module in IE8, it will fail due to no "catch" being present in the try/finally block. But this trade-off seems fair.

re-enable run-time cycles.

Please note this does NOT (and will not) address design time module cycles.
tidy up loader.js

imagemin should not empty files if run repeatedly

imagemin should not empty files if run repeatedly

There is an active bug in imagemin where if you run the task repeatedly it can start outputting empty files. Currently, the easiest way to get around it is to set the cache option to false.

https://github.com/gruntjs/grunt-contrib-imagemin/issues/140

Merge pull request #428 from rjackson/update_ember

Update to Ember 1.4.0-beta.2

Update to Ember 1.4.0-beta.2

Ember 1.3.1 has an issue that prevents loading/error substates from
working properly (see [detailed
comment](https://github.com/stefanpenner/ember-jj-abrams-resolver/issues/13#issuecomment-32726797)).

This was fixed upstream and is working properly on Ember 1.4.0-beta.2.

Allow clearing the registry.

This is useful for testing custom lookups in the resolver itself. I
would much prefer to keep this the same everywhere and it currently
seems that the canonical `loader.js` is here in EAK.

Also, moved the definition of `requirejs._eak_seen` to be outside of the
`requirejs` function. I am not sure why we would want to reset it
everytime that we call require.

Merge pull request #372 from bcardarella/bc-cleaner-default-env-files

Don't destroy global config object

Don't destroy global config object

This will encourage people not to destory their window.ENV object by
reassigning it a completely new value.

The environemnt specific files should load after `environemnt.js` has
loaded. This way the values assigned to `window.ENV` in those
environment specific files can overwrite any defaults set in
`environment.js`

I have also cleaned up the comments somewhat and included a simple
example of setting a config value.

Merge pull request #370 from rjackson/add_config

Add default config setup.

Add default config setup.

Allows specifying configuration in the following files:

* `config/environment.js` - This is loaded in all enviroments.
* `config/environments/production.js` - This is loaded when
  building with `grunt dist`.
* `config/environments/development.js` - This is loaded when
  building a normal development server (via `grunt server` generally).
* `config/environments/test.js` - This is loaded when running tests via
  either browsing to `/tests` URL or running via karma.

No reason to make people write this boilerplate themselves, right?

Merge pull request #336 from pangratz/improve_proxy

Proxy method can be specified via arguments

Proxy method can be specified via arguments

The previously introduced proxy feature can be configured by setting the
`APIMethod` and `proxyURL` properties in the `express-server` options.

This change makes it possible to quickly change the used proxy method by
specifying an argument to the `server` and `test:server` task: to use
the `stub` proxy method, run `grunt server:stub` or `grunt
test:server:stub` and to proxy the requests to a proxy server, invoke
`grunt server:proxy` or `grunt test:server:proxy`.

If no proxy method is specified (aka `grunt:server`), then the proxy
configuration from the `express-server` options is used.

Added a note to reverse-word.js about the need for Handlebars helpers to contain a dash.

Handlebars helpers' name need to have a dash, or they won't be found by the (lazy) resolver, unless they're declared explicitly. I added a note to the reverse-word.js example to help make this clear.

Merge pull request #313 from rjackson/use_correct_compiler_versions

Use vendored template compiler.

Use vendored template compiler.

Recent changes to Ember 1.2.0-beta.3 broke compatiblity with templates
compiled with prior versions of the `ember-template-compiler`.

This change allows us to use the version bundled in Bower with ember
itself.

Additional Notes:

* `grunt-ember-templates` added support for using custom
  templateCompilerPath/handlebarsPath in v0.4.17 (see [here](https://github.com/dgeb/grunt-ember-templates/pull/53)).
* The Ember package in bower is now publishing the template compiler
  (see
  [here](https://github.com/components/ember/commit/a1fc1f0f77d6cbeb854c9ba5ad328977e3e08d90)).
* A PR has been submitted to Ember (see
  [here](https://github.com/emberjs/ember.js/pull/3776)) to publish the
  template compiler along with release/beta/canary builds.

Merge pull request #287 from joliss/watch-performance

Speed up watching

Speed up watching

On my Linux, it's not using inotify for some reason -- perhaps some
issue with the gaze package (https://github.com/shama/gaze). We should
be using inotify eventually, but when we're not, we still want to be
fast. 20ms polling interval on a 100ms build step seems alright. (That's
100ms without spawning, which we can't disable quite yet though --
https://github.com/stefanpenner/ember-app-kit/pull/287#discussion_r7433842.)

fullNames should be dasherized: controller:user/foo-bar
the container normalizes everything to be dasherized.

on-disk representation can be either dasherized or underscored.
for file names: foo-bar-baz === foo_bar_baz

This is to allows components appkit-input and
controllers: cool_guy to work nicely in the same app.

Improve test ergonomics:

- app.js now exports a application class, not instance.
- acceptance tests no longer rely on App#reset, rather they create/destroy a new application instance each time.
- App no longer pollutes unit and integration tests
- startApp helper is provide for acceptance tests, boots the app in "testing mode"
- isolatedContainer is provided for integration (maybe unit) tests. isolatedContainer builds a container with "white listed" resolver rules. This helps ensure your integration test isolation remains in you control, but while still benefiting from the resolver.

Merge pull request #93 from mixonic/wildcard

Better wildcard fall-through for assets

Only serve the wildcard if:

  * GET or HEAD is being called.
  * There are no "." characters in the URL, OR the url extension starts
    with "htm", OR the url extension is over 5 chars long.

This will cause JavaScript and other assets to fail with 404 errors as
normally expected.

Ref:
https://github.com/stefanpenner/ember-app-kit/commit/02882c7da3e3745606c595ea5566b52bff7567a2#commitcomment-3963307

Naive source-maps with grunt-concat-sourcemap

These source maps are generated at concat time from the transpiled
output, so they of course don't map 1:1 with the original lines. Still,
it's a start, and keeps devs from having to debug a giant concatenated
file. (the transpiler output is reasonably readable, of course)

Also dropped the camelize in the Gruntfile's config loader, as the task
name for grunt-concat-sourcemap is actually `concat_sourcemap`.

Merge pull request #66 from rjackson/update_to_rc_7

Update to Ember 1.0.0-rc.7.
server:dist now serves dist/ (closes #73)

Add a fallback route to index.html in development

Ember apps are single-page. Ember appkit requires that you enter the app
via index.html or another pre-defined file in public. If you have
dynamic URLs, this sucks. You can't just reload a page and be back at
the state you were in a moment before.

This adds wildcard middleware to connect. If a file/directory cannot be
loaded via the traditional pipeline, then the wildcard picks it up and
tries to return index.html or another file configured as the `wildcard`
property on the connect options.

So reload that dynamic URL at will, ye masters of Ember.
remove vendorCss configuration and its usage in tests + public index.html
